userreviews.userReview: I gave this book 5 stars because it has my favorite qualities about a book. It has action, romance, horses, and its christian fiction to top it all off. Rarely do I find all those qualities in a christian fiction book!!!Positives - The main character`s faith is strengthened, Lessons can be learned, and the moral of the story, that we cannot run from our fears forever!Negatives - You never find out which guy she chooses....  Life is so meaningless to Develyn Worrell. After the death of her ex husband and the blame of his death on Develyn by her twenty-one year old daughter, Develyn must escape to the place of her youth in a little dirt road town in Wyoming. She drives off in her jeep and heads out there with no idea where this place is located. Along the way she stops for a rest at a halfway diner. She meets a friend in the most unusual of places, and she is able to share her feelings with this unknown angel. With a refreshed head Develyn leaves the diner and gets back on the road. After some asking around ( and meeting a strange man who believes in aliens ) she is given a flyer for a horse auction. When she is totally at a loss to find her town she drives off to find this horse auction. To her surprise this town that the auction was in is the same town she remembers. Develyn transforms from this careful schoolteacher to an whitty, hard to catch,and daring cowgirl that gathers the attention of every cowboy out there. With these new attentions she feels as if she a woman again. At this mustang auction Develyn makes a new friend that is totally opposite her personality, and also at this auction she makes her first purchase of a skewbold mustang mare. After the auction she loads up her mustang and before she leaves she is invited to a invatation only party at a big ranch ( well known political leaders and actors attend also). The owner of this ranch catches her eye and He also feels something for her. Several men express their interest in her, but by the ending of this book it seems her interest stick with the big ranch owner. There is also an adventure in this book as Develyn makes a stupid decision to ride farther than she find her way back from. Her situation goes from bad to worse as her horse runs off with a herd of wild horses, it starts to rain, she meets two cattle rustlers, and they point a gun at her and her horse (on the edge of a cliff)..............................  I hope I have sparked your interest in this book and you will read the rest.

This was my first Stephen Bly book and I was totally taken in with his writing right from the beginning. He is witty and funny and creates great characters but most importantly, he reminds us of God’s love for us and His understanding that we are sinners who strive each and every day to do His will.In this story, Develyn Worrell is a widowed forty-five-year-old fifth grade school teacher from central Indiana. Her 22-year-old daughter, Delaney, is estranged from her because she feels Develyn’s lack of forgiveness contributed to her father’s sudden heart attack. With school being out for the summer and feeling lonely and out of sorts, Develyn decides to load up the car and drive to Wyoming from Indiana.When Develyn was ten, she and her family had vacationed in a small central Wyoming town and she decides to head there for the summer in hopes of recreating the experience she enjoyed so much on that vacation 35 years previously.What Develyn finds is not only her past, but her present and future as well. The cast of characters that help her along the way play a big part in helping her grow in herself and in her trust of God.I’ll definitely be looking for more of Stephen Bly’s books and would recommend this one to everyone!

This is the modern-day trek of a 45-year-old Indiana schoolteacher to find the little Wyoming town where she spent her favorite vacation when she was 10. She thinks she's on a journey to recover from some hard turns in her life, but she has no idea what is in store. If these were not written by a man I would be tempted to call them western chic lit, but as it is they just happen to be so fun that you feel like you are right there, learning alongside Develyn as God helps her reconcile her past, learn from and embrace the now, and let Him be in charge of the future. I felt that the characters I could relate to were well-written and the relationships true-to-life... and you're missing out if you've never heard about a watch-burro. ;-) The two sequels help wrap up Devy's story.

Very easy to read and heartwarming story about a woman going back to the place of a favorite childhood memory(family vacation)..she just takes off with no real plan(very brave)and by herself(not sure I could do that but would like to think I could) The main character is a middle aged school teacher who discovers who she is and most importantly...you have to find the joy in life!!! Live life!!! Most of the story did take place in Wyoming with horses which may be one of the reasons I liked it..(got some of that Wyoming clay dirt in my blood) The writing was ok. This is the first book in a series and I may have to read the next one to find out what happens.

I am so enjoying this story, that I'm already halfway into the second book of this triology. This would make a wonderful Lifetime movie its got so much happening that you don't want to put it down and you want to get right into the next book! Very well written and very interesting and love the humorous parts...I am interesting in seeing what else this author has written!

This is one of my all-time favorite books...I have read it read it again and again, and it still makes me smile and I still get worried at the suspenseful parts. Amazing book about what love really is and how much of an adventure you can have when you just let go....It reminds you that your life is never over and you don't have to settle for less.
I loved this book and this series!! Such a great story! Jesus, romance, and cowboys.....I don't think it can get any better!!!
Could not put this book down. I started this morning and just finished. I can't wait to start the next book and seen who the school teacher falls for.
Loved this series! Hated it when they ended!
Start of a good series, clean and fun.
I loved this book! I read it while at the beach. I'm waiting to get the second one. It's about a women who tried to find the dirt road town that her parents car broke down on when she was 10.
great book read on Kindle. Was a page turner with surprizes and twists and humor. MIddle aged teacher looking for who she is for herself not who she is to everyone else in her life.
Great Series. I have read all of his books and loved everyone of them. If you like cowboys, these books are for you. A good love story. My husband reads & enjoys his books too.
I absolutely loved this series. Stephen Bly is such a great author. The story is romantic without being mushy. It is all about finding yourself and where you belong.
This was a fun read and made me homesick for central Wyoming.

Maybe it’s a summer thing, I’ve read two books with road themes, at least in the title.Memories of Dirt Road Town was written by Stephen Bly, who passed away this summer.Develyn Worrell, a fifth grade teacher in Indiana, is ready to escape. It is the start of summer vacation and she sets out to find a town in Wyoming she remembers visiting as a child. She divorced her husband three years ago because of his affair. Their daughter blames her for the divorce and her father’s recent death.Devy heads out in her Jeep Cherokee with only a vague idea of where she’s headed. It’s the craziest and also most exhilarating thing she’s ever done. She finds her way to a wild horse auction and meets some true Wyoming characters – a bronc buster, a woman named Casey Cree-Ryder who lives in a horse trailer, a wealthy rancher who owns half of two counties, a burro, and a landlord who has a secret to hide.The beginning of the book, involving two middle aged school teachers talking, is rather awkward and prolonged. But once the story reaches Wyoming, it comes to life, just like Devy, and Bly has a vivid and humorous way of describing the beauty and desolation of the West. There’s a romantic element of the story, but that thread doesn’t get completely developed, so looks like I’ll have to read the rest of the trilogy to find out who gets the girl.

Maybe it’s a summer thing, I’ve read two books with road themes, at least in the title.Memories of Dirt Road Town was offered at 99 cents by the publisher to honor author Stephen Bly, who passed away this summer.Develyn Worrell, a fifth grade teacher in Indiana, is ready to escape. It is the start of summer vacation and she sets out to find a town in Wyoming she remembers visiting as a child. She divorced her husband three years ago because of his affair. Their daughter blames her for the divorce and her father’s recent death.Devy heads out in her Jeep Cherokee with only a vague idea of where she’s headed. I am only giving this book 3 stars due to the fact that, although I really enjoyed the trilogy, I do not like books that leave you hanging until you are lucky enough to get your hands on the next book.

Loved the characters; loved the story line; loved the setting! It's important to me to find a book that is well written, and does not see the "need" to resort to inappropriate language or descriptions. Looking forward to reading the next book in the series!
My first Stephen Bly book. A little too much reminding the reader she is an Indiana school teacher, but that is setting her identity. On to the next in this series!
This is a very human story with heart!
YA Bly
An ok book over all, however it kind of jumps around with Develyn's thoughts.
Loved it. First of Stephen Bly's books I have read. Wonderful writer. This book is the first of a trilogy and I already have the other two.
This was the first book I have read by this author. It turned out to be a pretty good story.
I loved this book!
Very coolThis is a great book Very humorous keep you in stitches. I really enjoyed reading a story that's not so serious. Just a good relaxing book to read

description: A fifth-grade school teacher in southern Illinois, Develyn Worrell's nightmare begins one summer when she discovers her husband's infidelity. She divorces him without ever telling her twenty-one-year-old daughter why. Although Devvy has a heart change and desires for reconciliation, he dies before she can tell him of her desire. The daughter blames her mother for her father's death. Memories of a Dirt Road Town begins the story the following summer. Brokenhearted about her husband's death and her daughter's decision not to come home for the summer, Devvy decides to find a little dirt road town in Wyoming where she had vacationed as a child. She remembers fondly the sunset and a beautiful Roan horse. Upon arrival, Devvy purchases a Roan mare and a burro, rents a little cabin, and watches as God brings three very important men into her life.
title:
Memories of a Dirt Road Town
      
          (Horse Dreams Trilogy #1)
